Integrator GUI API reference¶

The “CreateAzimJson” module¶

Class to create .azimint.json file using the .poni calibration file, a detector mask (edf file) and the number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)

@author: A. Vamvakeros

class nDTomo.Integrator.CreateAzimJson.CreatAzimint(ponifile, mask, npt_rad)[source]¶
run()[source]¶

Creates a .azimint.json file using the .poni calibration file

The “DCalibration” module¶

Calibration class calls pyFAI-calib to create the detector calibration CreatMask class creates a detector mask

@authors: A. Vamvakeros, the methods of the CreatMask class were written by G. Vaughan

class nDTomo.Integrator.DCalibration.Calibration(calibrant, energy)[source]¶
run()[source]¶

Run pyFAI-calib (detector calibration)

class nDTomo.Integrator.DCalibration.CreatMask(calibrant)[source]¶
run()[source]¶

Run pyFAI-drawmask (detector calibration)

The “ScatterTomoInt” module¶

Class used to integrate XRD-CT using CPU or GPU

@author: A. Vamvakeros

class nDTomo.Integrator.ScatterTomoInt.XRDCT_Squeeze(prefix, dataset, xrdctpath, maskname, poniname, na, nt, npt_rad, filt, procunit, units, prc, thres, datatype, savepath, scantype, energy, omega, trans, dio, etime)[source]¶

XRD-CT data integration with CPU or GPU

prefix:prefix used for the filenames of the experimental data
dataset:foldername where the experimental data are stored
xrdctpath:full path where the experimental data are stored
maskname:detector mask file (‘mask.edf’)
poniname:.poni file (‘filename.poni’)
na:number of angular steps during the tomographic scan
nt:number of translation steps during the tomographic scan
npt_rad:number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)
procunit:processing unit, options are: ‘CPU’, ‘GPU’ and ‘MultiGPU’
units:x axis units for the integrated diffraction patterns, options are: ‘q_A^-1’ or ‘2th_deg’
prc:percentage to be used for the trimmed mean filter
thres:number of standard deviation values to be used for the adaptive standard deviation filter
datatype:type of image files, options are: ‘edf’ or ‘cbf’
savepath:full path where results will be saved
scantype:scantype, options are: ‘Zigzag’, ‘ContRot’ and ‘Interlaced’
energy:X-ray energy in keV
jsonname:full path for the .azimint.json file
omega:rotation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
trans:translation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
dio:diode values per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)
etime:values for exposure time per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)
run()[source]¶

Initiate the XRD-CT data integration process

tth2q()[source]¶

Convert 2theta to d and q spacing

writehdf5()[source]¶
Export the integrated diffraction data from the tomographic scan as a single .hdf5 file.

The integrated data are saved as a 2D array.

The “ContRotTomoInt_Live” module¶

Class to integrate XRD-CT data collected with the continuous rotation-translation method. The integration can be performed with CPU, GPU, or the multi-CPU ID15A PC. The type of integration process is intended to be couple with live visualization.

@author: A. Vamvakeros

class nDTomo.Integrator.ContRotTomoInt_Live.Fast_XRDCT_LiveSqueeze(prefix, dataset, xrdctpath, maskname, poniname, na, nt, npt_rad, filt, procunit, units, prc, thres, datatype, savepath, scantype, energy, jsonname, omega, trans, dio, etime)[source]¶

Integrate continuous rotation-translation XRD-CT data

prefix:prefix used for the filenames of the experimental data
dataset:foldername where the experimental data are stored
xrdctpath:full path where the experimental data are stored
maskname:detector mask file (‘mask.edf’)
poniname:.poni file (‘filename.poni’)
na:number of angular steps during the tomographic scan
nt:number of translation steps during the tomographic scan
npt_rad:number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)
procunit:processing unit, options are: ‘CPU’, ‘GPU’ and ‘MultiGPU’
units:x axis units for the integrated diffraction patterns, options are: ‘q_A^-1’ or ‘2th_deg’
prc:percentage to be used for the trimmed mean filter
thres:number of standard deviation values to be used for the adaptive standard deviation filter
datatype:type of image files, options are: ‘edf’ or ‘cbf’
savepath:full path where results will be saved
scantype:scantype, options are: ‘Zigzag’, ‘ContRot’ and ‘Interlaced’
energy:X-ray energy in keV
jsonname:full path for the .azimint.json file
omega:rotation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
trans:translation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
dio:diode values per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)
etime:values for exposure time per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)

Look if data have been generated (MultiGPU method)

checkForImageFileOar()[source]¶

Look if data have been generated (CPU and GPU method)

Create the .json file for the diffraction data integration using the MultiGPU method

gpuproc()[source]¶

Use the dahu-reprocess method to perform the diffraction data integration using the MultiGPU method

Perform the diffraction data integration using pyFAI (CPU and GPU method)

setnextimageFile()[source]¶

Set the next target image file (MultiGPU method)

Set the next target image file (CPU and GPU method)

Perform the diffraction data integration using the MultiGPU method

writehdf5()[source]¶

Export the integrated diffraction data from a linescan as a single .hdf5 file

The “ContRotTomoInt_LiveMulti” module¶

Class to integrate XRD-CT data collected with the continuous rotation-translation method. The integration is performed with the multi-GPU ID15A PC only. This type of integration process is intended to be couple with live visualization.

@author: A. Vamvakeros

class nDTomo.Integrator.ContRotTomoInt_LiveMulti.Fast_XRDCT_ID15ASqueeze(prefix, dataset, xrdctpath, maskname, poniname, na, nt, npt_rad, filt, procunit, units, prc, thres, datatype, savepath, scantype, energy, jsonname, omega, trans, dio, etime)[source]¶

Integrate continuous rotation-translation XRD-CT data

prefix:prefix used for the filenames of the experimental data
dataset:foldername where the experimental data are stored
xrdctpath:full path where the experimental data are stored
maskname:detector mask file (‘mask.edf’)
poniname:.poni file (‘filename.poni’)
na:number of angular steps during the tomographic scan
nt:number of translation steps during the tomographic scan
npt_rad:number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)
procunit:processing unit, options are: ‘CPU’, ‘GPU’ and ‘MultiGPU’
units:x axis units for the integrated diffraction patterns, options are: ‘q_A^-1’ or ‘2th_deg’
prc:percentage to be used for the trimmed mean filter
thres:number of standard deviation values to be used for the adaptive standard deviation filter
datatype:type of image files, options are: ‘edf’ or ‘cbf’
savepath:full path where results will be saved
scantype:scantype, options are: ‘Zigzag’, ‘ContRot’ and ‘Interlaced’
energy:X-ray energy in keV
jsonname:full path for the .azimint.json file
omega:rotation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
trans:translation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
dio:diode values per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)
etime:values for exposure time per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)

The “ContRotTomoInt_LiveRead” module¶

Class to read live XRD-CT integrated data collected with the continuous rotation-translation method

@author: A. Vamvakeros

class nDTomo.Integrator.ContRotTomoInt_LiveRead.Fast_XRDCT_LiveRead(prefix, dataset, xrdctpath, maskname, poniname, na, nt, npt_rad, filt, procunit, units, prc, thres, datatype, savepath, scantype, energy, jsonname, omega, trans, dio, etime)[source]¶

prefix:prefix used for the filenames of the experimental data
dataset:foldername where the experimental data are stored
xrdctpath:full path where the experimental data are stored
maskname:detector mask file (‘mask.edf’)
poniname:.poni file (‘filename.poni’)
na:number of angular steps during the tomographic scan
nt:number of translation steps during the tomographic scan
npt_rad:number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)
procunit:processing unit, options are: ‘CPU’, ‘GPU’ and ‘MultiGPU’
units:x axis units for the integrated diffraction patterns, options are: ‘q_A^-1’ or ‘2th_deg’
prc:percentage to be used for the trimmed mean filter
thres:number of standard deviation values to be used for the adaptive standard deviation filter
datatype:type of image files, options are: ‘edf’ or ‘cbf’
savepath:full path where results will be saved
scantype:scantype, options are: ‘Zigzag’, ‘ContRot’ and ‘Interlaced’
energy:X-ray energy in keV
jsonname:full path for the .azimint.json file
omega:rotation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
trans:translation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
dio:diode values per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)
etime:values for exposure time per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)

The “ZigzagTomoInt_Live” module¶

Class to integrate XRD-CT data collected with the zigzag method. The integration can be performed with CPU, GPU, or the multi-CPU ID15A PC. The type of integration process is intended to be couple with live visualization.

@author: A. Vamvakeros

class nDTomo.Integrator.ZigzagTomoInt_Live.XRDCT_LiveSqueeze(prefix, dataset, xrdctpath, maskname, poniname, na, nt, npt_rad, filt, procunit, units, prc, thres, datatype, savepath, scantype, energy, jsonname, omega, trans, dio, etime)[source]¶

Integrate zigzag XRD-CT data

prefix:prefix used for the filenames of the experimental data
dataset:foldername where the experimental data are stored
xrdctpath:full path where the experimental data are stored
maskname:detector mask file (‘mask.edf’)
poniname:.poni file (‘filename.poni’)
na:number of angular steps during the tomographic scan
nt:number of translation steps during the tomographic scan
npt_rad:number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)
procunit:processing unit, options are: ‘CPU’, ‘GPU’ and ‘MultiGPU’
units:x axis units for the integrated diffraction patterns, options are: ‘q_A^-1’ or ‘2th_deg’
prc:percentage to be used for the trimmed mean filter
thres:number of standard deviation values to be used for the adaptive standard deviation filter
datatype:type of image files, options are: ‘edf’ or ‘cbf’
savepath:full path where results will be saved
scantype:scantype, options are: ‘Zigzag’, ‘ContRot’ and ‘Interlaced’
energy:X-ray energy in keV
jsonname:full path for the .azimint.json file
omega:rotation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
trans:translation axis motor positions during the tomographic scan (1d array)
dio:diode values per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)
etime:values for exposure time per point during the tomographic scan (1d array)

class nDTomo.Integrator.ZigzagTomoInt_LiveRead.XRDCT_LiveRead(prefix, dataset, xrdctpath, maskname, poniname, na, nt, npt_rad, filt, procunit, units, prc, thres, datatype, savepath, scantype, energy, jsonname, omega, trans, dio, etime)[source]¶

prefix:prefix used for the filenames of the experimental data
dataset:foldername where the experimental data are stored
xrdctpath:full path where the experimental data are stored
maskname:detector mask file (‘mask.edf’)
poniname:.poni file (‘filename.poni’)
na:number of angular steps during the tomographic scan
nt:number of translation steps during the tomographic scan
npt_rad:number of bins used for the diffraction pattern (e.g. 2048)
procunit:processing unit, options are: ‘CPU’, ‘GPU’ and ‘MultiGPU’
units:x axis units for the integrated diffraction patterns, options are: ‘q_A^-1’ or ‘2th_deg’
prc:percentage to be used for the trimmed mean filter
thres:number of standard deviation values to be used for the adaptive standard deviation filter
datatype:type of image files, options are: ‘edf’ or ‘cbf’
